Signal: EBITDA margin collapsed to 2.94% in FY24 — down from 9%+ in FY21 — representing the most severe profitability stress point in the dataset before partial recovery
Severity Rationale: Near-breakeven EBITDA signals structural cost-price misalignment and/or top-line collapse; strongest profitability distress signal in the dataset; a sub-3% EBITDA margin on Rs.931Cr revenue is a prime A&M intervention trigger requiring cost structure and pricing diagnostics
Evidence (Verbatim): FY24 EBITDA 2.94%; FY25 7.55%; Q2 FY26 9.5%. Operating profitability has increased due to improved margins and optimisation of all spends | Auxiliary categories declined as we took a calibrated approach towards product portfolio and trade spending to enhance profitability.
Line Reference: Section 4 – Pricing Strategy and Commodity Cost Impact, Line 103; Section 6 – Gross Margin Strategy, Line 185

Signal: Steel — the largest direct material input — has NO alternate vendor; single-source concentration risk explicitly acknowledged in the risk management section with no remediation timeline disclosed
Severity Rationale: Largest direct cost input with zero supply chain redundancy; any supplier disruption or price shock has no mitigation buffer; structural fragility that A&M would flag as Priority 1 supply chain remediation in any turnaround engagement
Evidence (Verbatim): Alternative vendor development and structured share of business implemented for high-value procurement (except Steel).

Indicator: Industry vs Company Growth – Revenue Trajectory
Signal: Revenue declined from FY23 peak of Rs.1057 Cr to Rs.865 Cr in FY25 — a cumulative decline of 18% over 2 years — against a stated intent to expand pan-India market share
Severity Rationale: Sustained multi-year revenue contraction erodes scale economics, distributor ROI, and channel confidence; even if partly intentional, 18% revenue loss risks becoming structural if recovery stalls beyond core categories
Evidence (Verbatim): In the fiscal year, the company reported a revenue of H 86,450.15 Lakhs compared to H 93,128.25 Lakhs in the previous year. | Revenue peaked at Rs.1,057 Cr (FY23), then declined to Rs.865 Cr (FY25) amid strategic reset.

Severity Rationale: Demonstrated structural vulnerability to commodity cycles with no disclosed hedging or pass-through mechanism; recurring risk that caused near-critical profitability stress in FY22 and cascaded into the FY24 EBITDA collapse; A&M would mandate a hedging and procurement resilience programme
